pageProps.content:
Experience

Chobe Chilwero is set deep in the heart of the Botswana wilderness & borders the world-famous Chobe National Park. Its superb location on the edge of the Chobe River allows for magnificent sunsets & breathtaking scenery.
Game viewing in this area is phenomenal, especially in the dryer winter months when animals make their way towards the river, one of their only life sources in the area.

Stay

Chobe Chilwero is a luxurious riverside retreat with only 14 suites & 1 pool suite, ensuring guests have an intimate safari experience. This is the first lodge with a full-service spa on the Botswana circuit.
Each suite features a sunken handcrafted bath, indoor & outdoor shower, private garden with hammock & balcony overlooking the Chobe River.
The main area with lounge & dining room commands fabulous views over the river which attracts a variety of game, including large elephant & buffalo herds.

Activities

Professional guides will accompany you on open 4x4 game drives, allowing for up-close & personal wildlife encounters.
A sunset boat cruise on the Chobe River is the perfect way to end a relaxing day in the bush, allowing you to sip on a cocktail & to enjoy the peace & tranquillity Africa has to offer.
Photographic river cruises can seat up to 18 guests, & has a lower & upper deck, both featuring 360 degrees swivel seats. These boat cruises are ideal for photographic enthusiasts.
Sanctuary Chobe Chilwero is a family-friendly safari lodge, so welcomes kids of all ages. A host of children’s activities & programs are available to keep the young ones busy, for example - guided walking safaris around the lodge, a “safari treasure hunt,” kiddies croquet on the lawn, make-your-own pizza with the Chef & shortened game drives.

subfolders.title: Chobe Game Lodge
subfolders.description: Chobe National Park, globally acclaimed as the 'home of elephants,' is a premier destination for those seeking an unforgettable Chobe National Park elephant safari experience. This remarkable park harbors Africa's largest congregation of wildlife, offering visitors unparalleled encounters with vast herds of elephants &amp buffaloes. In fact, about 120,000 elephants live in & around the national park, & inconceivable numbers of these gentle giants can be seen crowding the banks of the Chobe River during Botswana’s dry season from May to October. Hosting about 120,000 elephants, Chobe National Park presents an unparalleled opportunity for wildlife spotting in the dry season. During Botswana’s dry season from May to October, witness the majestic sight of elephants along the Chobe River. This park is also a hotspot for spotting predators like lions, leopards, wild dogs, hyenas, &amp jackals.

subfolders.title: Chobe Princess
subfolders.description: The Chobe Princess is a luxury houseboat based on the Chobe River in Botswana, but it is officially a joint Namibian & Botswana property as the river forms the boundary between these two countries. A unique & elegant experience, The Chobe Princess will take you on a journey through some of Africa’s most beautiful & scenic regions. Two of the Chobe Princess houseboats have four cabins each:  3 Standard and 1 Superior Cabin.

subfolders.title: Chobe Savanna Lodge
subfolders.description: Chobe Savanna Lodge is set in the Eastern Caprivi, a narrow strip of country on the Northern bank of the Chobe River.  The lodge enjoys spectacular views over the Chobe National Park, home to large herds of elephants, buffalo & hippo. The most prominent feature at Chobe Savanna is a thatched open-sided section of the lodge where guests can enjoy a 270 degrees view over the Chobe River & Chobe National Park. Small & intimate, the lodge has 12 luxury chalets, each with a private deck, integrated bedroom & lounge, as well as en-suite facilities.  Room are all air-conditioned.

subfolders.title: Chobe Under Canvas
subfolders.description: Chobe Under Canvas is a luxury mobile camp, ideally positioned close to the Chobe River in the world-renowned Chobe National Park. A Botswana safari is not complete without a visit to Chobe where large herds of elephants & buffalo are frequently seen.  Chobe Under Canvas combines rustic luxury with iconic wildlife encounters, & therefore is a wildlife enthusiast’s dream come true. There are only 5 luxury canvas tents at Chobe Under Canvas, each with an en-suite bathroom & alfresco bucket shower, with hot water delivered on request.

subfolders.title: Elephant Valley Lodge
subfolders.description: Elephant Valley Lodge lies between the world-renowned Chobe National Park & the Matetsi Wildlife Conservancy in the Kasane Forest Reserve of Botswana. The lodge overlooks an extremely productive waterhole, which serves as one of the main attractions at camp as passing wildlife often gather here. The lodge comprises 12 Meru-style forest tents located under the shady canopy of trees as well as 8 valley tents with views overlooking the valley & waterhole.  Each tent is comfortably furnished with a luxurious en-suite bathroom & private verandah.

subfolders.title: Ngoma Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Ngoma Safari Lodge is located within the Chobe Forest Reserve in Western Botswana, a mere 3 km from the Chobe National Park.  This region is renowned for its outstanding wildlife, including the famous Chobe Elephants, & home to more than 75 mammals & 450 bird species. The lodge is set on the edge of a plateau, offering endless views over the seasonal Chobe flood plains.  Magnificent sunsets are celebrated here – the perfect way to end an African day. Ngoma Safari Lodge boasts 8 river-facing suites, designed with an emphasis on space & comfort.

subfolders.title: Zambezi Queen
subfolders.description: The Zambezi Queen is a luxury houseboat based on the Chobe River in Botswana, but it is officially a joint Namibian & Botswana property as the river forms the boundary between these two countries. A unique & elegant experience, The Zambezi Queen will take you on a journey through some of Africa’s most beautiful & scenic regions. The first & second levels of the boat consist of 14 cabins – all equipped with private balconies.  The cabins have been tastefully furnished with either a double or 2 single beds.  Of these 14 suites, 4 are master suites, some with private outdoor areas.
